Unlikely Pairs

rad pic by ubc guru carl

New things in the UBC this week! A grip of books, vintage and new that you must get your mitts on: Game of Thrones themed erotica! Agatha Christie paperbacks from the 60s! Essays by Robert Anasi!

And a pretty Halloween-themed window up front courtesy of your fearless author.

A propos of the patterns I mentioned in last week’s post, it’s easy to see patterns in the names of authors who come across the UBC desk. How different can two authors who share the same last name be?

<div style="text-align: center;">Lee Child and Julia Child</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Ted Hughes and Langston Hughes</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Mary McCarthy and Cormac McCarthy</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Flann O’Brien and Tim O’Brien</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Gertrude Stein and Garth Stein</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Pagan Kennedy and John F. Kennedy</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Zoe Heller and Joseph Heller

Gillian Flynn and Vince Flynn</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Jim Davis and Lydia Davis</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Jim Morrison and Toni Morrison</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Tony Kushner and Harold Kushner</div><div style="text-align: center;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">Gary Larson and Erik Larson</div>
More importantly, who would win in a fight between these pairs? We’ve got books by all of ‘em and more in the UBC! Collect ‘em all.
